intro: Stelis villifera, commonly known as the veined stelis, is an epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It typically grows on trees in humid, shaded forest environments. The plant features a short, creeping stem with numerous clustered, small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are elongated and often have a waxy texture to reduce water loss. Stelis villifera is valued in horticulture for its delicate appearance and adaptability to cultivated conditions.
